New York University Archives
Records of the English Graduate Association
New York University. English Graduate Association
RG.39.20
.25 linear feet in 1 half manuscript box
1946-1975 The English Graduate Association was an organization founded in 1946 for students and alumni of the English program in the Graduate School of Arts and Science. The organization was later succeeded by the Graduate English Organization. The records of the English Graduate Association (dated 1946-1975) consist of materials documenting the group's founding, administrative activities, and lectures on literary topics. Materials include correspondence, lists of officers, meeting minutes, annual reports, and summaries of lectures. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The records of the English Graduate Association (dated 1946-1975) consist of materials documenting the group's founding, administrative activities, and lectures on literary topics. Materials include correspondence, lists of officers, meeting minutes, annual reports, and summaries of lectures.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Original order is unknown.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact New York University Archives, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
These materials were removed from the New York University Archives Collection of Publications and Ephemera during processing; their original provenance is unknown.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Records of the English Graduate Association; RG 39.20; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in an archival box, and described on the collection-level with a folder-level inventory.
Historical Note
The English Graduate Association was an organization founded in 1946 for students and alumni of the English program in the Graduate School of Arts and Science. The organization was later succeeded by the Graduate English Organization.
